Material used.Description: SK-N-SH cells were transiently transfected with various constructs and then fixed, immunostained, and analyzed by confocal microscopy.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (failed to redistribute to damaged mitochondria, did not induce mitophagy, formed inclusions)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (failed to induce mitophagy)
Readout description.Result Description: Parkin(C289G) formed multiple large inclusions throughout the cytoplasm and nucleus in approximately 86% of cells. It did not overlap with mitochondrial staining after CCCP treatment, failed to stimulate mitochondrial clustering, and did not induce mitophagy. HSJ1a co - expression reduced inclusion incidence, rescued its relocation to damaged mitochondria, and restored later steps in mitophagy.

Readout description.Conclusion: Normal (able to relocate to damaged mitochondria, induced mitophagy)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: No Effect (retained ability to induce mitophagy)
Readout description.Result Description: Parkin(R42P) aggregated into multiple small perinuclear inclusions in approximately 22% of cells. It was recruited to damaged mitochondria as efficiently as Parkin(WT) and retained its ability to mediate mitochondrial clustering.

Biological replicates.Description: All experiments were carried out at least three times.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: An unpaired two - sample t - test was used to analyze statistical significance. Mean, standard deviation, and standard error were calculated.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, normal was considered as the behavior of wild - type Parkin, e.g., normal relocation to mitochondria, induction of mitophagy)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, abnormal was considered as the failure of mutant Parkin to perform functions like wild - type, e.g., failure to relocate to mitochondria, induce mitophagy)

Material used.Description: SK-N-SH cells transfected with various constructs were analyzed for inclusion incidence, Parkin relocation to mitochondria, mitochondrial accumulation, and mitophagy.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (failed to redistribute to damaged mitochondria, did not induce mitophagy, formed inclusions)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (failed to induce mitophagy)
Readout description.Result Description: Quantification showed Parkin(C289G) had low overlap with mitochondrial staining, low mitochondrial clustering, and high Hsp60 staining (indicating failure to induce mitophagy). HSJ1a co - expression improved these parameters.

Readout description.Conclusion: Normal (able to relocate to damaged mitochondria, induced mitophagy)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: No Effect (retained ability to induce mitophagy)
Readout description.Result Description: Quantification showed Parkin(R42P) had efficient recruitment to mitochondria and mitochondrial clustering similar to Parkin(WT).

Biological replicates.Description: All experiments were carried out at least three times.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: An unpaired two - sample t - test was used to analyze statistical significance. Mean, standard deviation, and standard error were calculated.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, normal was considered as the behavior of wild - type Parkin, e.g., normal relocation to mitochondria, induction of mitophagy)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, abnormal was considered as the failure of mutant Parkin to perform functions like wild - type, e.g., failure to relocate to mitochondria, induce mitophagy)

Material used.Description: Transfected SK-N-SH cells were lysed and analyzed by SDS - PAGE and western blot.

Readout description.Result Description: Filter trap assay showed myc - HSJ1a and myc - HSJ1a(DUIM) reduced the amount of insoluble Parkin(C289G) retained on the cellulose acetate membrane, while myc - HSJ1a(H31Q) did not.

Biological replicates.Description: All experiments were carried out at least three times.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, normal was considered as non - aggregated Parkin)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, abnormal was considered as aggregated Parkin)

Material used.Description: Transfected SK-N-SH cells were fractionated into cytosolic and mitochondrial fractions.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (initially in cytosolic fraction, partial relocation to mitochondrial fraction with HSJ1a co - expression)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (failed to relocate without HSJ1a)
Readout description.Result Description: FLAG - Parkin(C289G) was exclusively detected in the cytosolic fraction. However, upon myc - HSJ1a(WT) co - expression, some of the FLAG - Parkin(C289G) shifted to the mitochondrial fraction following CCCP treatment.

Biological replicates.Description: All experiments were carried out at least three times.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, normal was considered as Parkin(WT) localization pattern)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, abnormal was considered as Parkin(C289G) initial localization pattern)

Material used.Description: Transfected SK-N-SH cells were lysed, diluted, and loaded onto a cellulose acetate membrane for analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: myc - HSJ1a and myc - HSJ1a(DUIM) reduced by 75% the amount of insoluble Parkin(C289G) that was retained on the cellulose acetate membrane, while myc - HSJ1a(H31Q) did not reduce it.

Biological replicates.Description: All experiments were carried out at least three times.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, normal was considered as low aggregation)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on the results, abnormal was considered as high aggregation)
